channel.title: Website Feedback
channel.description:
I'd like to hear what you have to say about my website. Any kind of feedback is appreciated. Although, if you don't like it, I'd prefer if you could explain why you don't like it.
Here is the link: www.macroing.org

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

I am not really that concerned about it at this time. But if I ever do get, I’ll just create a form for people to fill out and send instead… I can even add a check server-side, so they can only send one e-mail per whatever amount of time (if that’s needed to protect against spamming).

DoS- and DDoS-attacks might be hard to protect against, since all of them cannot be fully prevented (assuming they use huge Botnets or other powerful tools). But I am not really that concerned about that either at this time.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Skiddies don’t know shit about anything, hence why they’re called skiddies.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:12, topic:361850”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=458125.msg3358933#msg3358933 date=1286155290]

[quote author=object link=topic=458125.msg3355776#msg3355776 date=1285831016]
abraham2119: Okay, thanks for the feedback. So what offset would you personally prefer to use?

I james I: Thanks for the tips. Although, don’t you think the most “hardcore” e-mail crawlers would be able to gather your e-mail address either way? I mean, it’s not really that hard to create an e-mail crawler that does… Especially if you create a context-aware e-mail crawler.
[/quote]or just send the email through a server sided script…

php’s mail(), for instance
[/quote]Given that you have some protection on it since… yano, you could just refresh/send own header, etc. DoS so to speak…

I fink I used incorrect terminology, but I am excused due to drunken-ness.[/quote]that can be easily controlled with a captcha, since the average skiddie is unfamiliar with ocr techniques

Read full topic

I james I: Thanks for the tips. Although, don’t you think the most “hardcore” e-mail crawlers would be able to gather your e-mail address either way? I mean, it’s not really that hard to create an e-mail crawler that does… Especially if you create a context-aware e-mail crawler.
[/quote]or just send the email through a server sided script…

php’s mail(), for instance[/quote]Given that you have some protection on it since… yano, you could just refresh/send own header, etc. DoS so to speak…

I fink I used incorrect terminology, but I am excused due to drunken-ness.

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I seriously wouldn’t worry about it. If your email service is half decent (gmail) most spam will get filtered anyways, assuming you even get any.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:

I james I: Thanks for the tips. Although, don’t you think the most “hardcore” e-mail crawlers would be able to gather your e-mail address either way? I mean, it’s not really that hard to create an e-mail crawler that does… Especially if you create a context-aware e-mail crawler.[/quote]It’s better than just leaving it out there in plaintext.

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

steal this contact form: http://prizelive.net/sign_up

edit: if not, atleast protect your email from the source:

replace:

<label class="text_label">joergen_lundgren@hotmail.com</label>

with:

<label class="text_label">joergen_lundgren@hotmail.com</label>

or do it with js (with non javascript capabilities):

[code]
joergen_lundgren@hotmail.com
[/code]

Read full topic

i dont like the top offset it has

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Unhandled: Ah, okay; it really does make sense to be honest. So perhaps if I change the corners of the outer box to round ones instead? Also, of course I’m going to put an image as a logo there in the header, whenever I somehow manage to create one (I suck at that stuff). That might aswell make it look better overall. And, as mentioned earlier, I might aswell change the borders back to the less contrasting ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

object:

Also, what is it that resembles the late 90’s in your opinion? I know in some of my earlier websites I took up the whole screen, and that that would be one of the reasons. But now I only take up part of the screen.

Heh, all my examples seem to have updated their websites.

I just get that feeling from the entire website being square, essentially one colour, and having huge margins with black borders. That being said it is still a lot better than most websites of the era.

Really it is a decent design, and I’m just voicing my personal stylistic opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Unhandled: Thanks for the feedback. I actually had some blue-ish color earlier for my borders. It did look good, but I thought both looked good and couldn’t decide, so I changed back. But perhaps I should undo that change again.

Also, what is it that resembles the late 90’s in your opinion? I know in some of my earlier websites I took up the whole screen, and that that would be one of the reasons. But now I only take up part of the screen.

I usually use “body” before my selectors because I like to put the whole chain of selectors as they appear in the HTML documents also in my CSS documents.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Looks like the late 90’s. I would rethink your border colours, make them less contrasting with the contained background colour. Consider aligning the header banner text to the left.

Also you don’t really need to put “body” before all of your css selectors, but it’s not a big deal if it helps you sleep at night.

Read full topic
